Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a plant that is healthy and growing with plenty of water and light, depicting vibrant green leaves and strong stems.
The student can draw a plant that lacks water, showing signs of wilting or drooping leaves to indicate unhealthiness.
The student can illustrate a plant without sufficient light, demonstrating paleness or yellowish leaves to highlight its unhealthy state.
The student can use their drawings to effectively convey that plants need both water and light to thrive, perhaps by using arrows or other annotations.
The student can identify and illustrate patterns in plant health, comparing healthy with unhealthy conditions in a clear and detailed manner.
CANNOT: Minor gaps in labeling might occur, such as missing labels on a part of one panel, but these do not affect the overall understanding conveyed.
